thread.title: Six teenagers found dead in garden after party by dad after they failed to answer his phone calls
thread.title_full: Six teenagers found dead in garden after party by dad after they failed to answer his phone calls

author: Joshua Taylor
title: Six teenagers found dead in garden after party by dad after they failed to answer his phone calls
text:
News Six teenagers found dead in garden after party by dad after they failed to answer his phone calls The youths could have died from carbon monoxide poisoning from a wood stove in the small stone building where they were staying, according to police Share A police officer stands guard at the scene of the tragedy (Photo: DPA) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A horrified dad found six teenagers - including a brother and sister - dead at a garden party after turning up because they had not answered his calls. 
The devastated father discovered the lifeless bodies in a small stone house in the German town of Arnstein. 
The victims included his two children - named locally as Rebecca and Florian - and four other young men all aged 18 or 19. 
Police say there were no signs of violence and are investigating carbon monoxide poisoning as a possible cause of the deaths. 
The teenagers are believed to have used a wood stove in the building as temperatures dropped as low as -11 degrees. The entrance leading to the stone house where the bodies were found has been sealed off (Photo: DPA) A sign reading 'crime scene' is fixed to the gate (Photo: DPA) Read More Italy avalanche hotel survivor "ate ice and snow to quench her thirst" during terrifying 58-hour ordeal 
The father discovered the horror scene at 11pm on Sunday night. 
Police officer Bjorn Schmitt told the Bild newspaper : "The father wanted to see if everything is in order. He immediately called the rescue service." 
But it was already too late and all six were pronounced dead. 
"It does not point at all to a crime of violence," Mr Schmitt added. Temperatures plunged as low as -11 degrees on that night (Photo: DPA) Read More 
Asked about the likelihood of carbon monoxide poisoning, the officer added: "This is a possibility, but there are others." 
Post-mortem results will be available in the next few days to establish the exact causes of death. Like us on Facebook
